verbs.description: [ARG0: Russia 's foreign minister] [V: says] [ARG1: U.S. President Donald Trump indicated he could make a reciprocal trip to Russia if President Vladimir Putin were able to accept his invitation to the White House] .

Russia 's foreign minister says [ARG0: U.S. President Donald Trump] [V: indicated] [ARG1: he could make a reciprocal trip to Russia if President Vladimir Putin were able to accept his invitation to the White House] .

Russia 's foreign minister says U.S. President Donald Trump indicated he [V: could] make a reciprocal trip to Russia if President Vladimir Putin were able to accept his invitation to the White House .

Russia 's foreign minister says U.S. President Donald Trump indicated [ARG0: he] [ARGM-MOD: could] [V: make] [ARG1: a reciprocal trip to Russia] [ARGM-ADV: if President Vladimir Putin were able to accept his invitation to the White House] .

Russia 's foreign minister says U.S. President Donald Trump indicated he could make a reciprocal trip to Russia if [ARG1: President Vladimir Putin] [V: were] [ARG2: able to accept his invitation to the White House] .

Russia 's foreign minister says U.S. President Donald Trump indicated he could make a reciprocal trip to Russia if [ARG0: President Vladimir Putin] were able to [V: accept] [ARG1: his invitation to the White House] .
